{"step_by_step_thinking": "Induction agents are drugs used to induce anesthesia. Thiopental is a barbiturate that can be used for this purpose. Propofol is a commonly used induction agent. Nitrous oxide is a gas that is used in combination with other drugs for anesthesia, but it is not typically used as an induction agent. Halothane is a volatile anesthetic, not an induction agent.", "answer_choice": "B. Halothane"}
